question: Which of the following is the most powerful type of computer?
Which of the following people probably has the least amount of technical knowledge?
The Central Processing Unit (CPU) consists of:

options.text: Control unit, primary storage & secondary storage
Control unit, arithmetic-logic unit, primary storage

answer.text: Control unit, arithmetic-logic unit, primary storage

question: This is the part of the computer system that one can touch
Reusable optical storage will typically have the acronym ___
The __________ tells the computer how to use its components.
A(n) __________ is a program that makes the computer easier to use.
The ‘Difference Analyzer’ was created in the early 1920s by __
The most important or powerful computer in a typical network.
To access a mainframe or supercomputer, users often use a ___
What database function allows you to define the data your database is storing?
If you wanted to tell the database management system that a specific attribute contained numbers only, what would you need to set?
What key distinctly identifies a record in a database table?
What key links records from one database table to a record or records in another database table?
When you link one database table to another database table, what are you creating?
What would you need to establish if you wanted to insure that the key in one database table was the same as a key in another database table?
What database tool would you use to find answers to your questions about data stored in your database?
When we describe, or define, the categories of information we collect in an Excel worksheet, what type of table are we creating?
If you wished to limit what you would see on an Excel worksheet, what data function would you use?
If you wished to highlight, not hide, some information in a worksheet because it met some criteria, what Excel tool would you use?
What Excel tool allows you to create quickly and automatically summary data from a large data set?
When creating a custom filter in Excel, which of the following would not be considered a Boolean operator?
Which of the following is a good habit to get into when creating a worksheet?

options.text: Placing titles for columns in the first row of data
Using conditional formatting to spot spelling errors
Inserting comments in each cell to define that data or type of data
Grouping records according to some classification

answer.text: Placing titles for columns in the first row of data

question: What term is used to describe a collection of information that you can use to build reports or discover facts about an environment?

This technology is used to convert XML into HTML.

---------- A hacker contacts you by phone or email and attempts to acquire your password.

A word in a web page that, when clicked, opens another document.

question: Which computer virus records every movement you make on your computer?

options.text: Reduce size of systems being developed

question: What kind of programming language is Java?
What type of internet technology sends information to you without you requesting that information?
What is the second generation of the Web called?
What type of web technology allows its community members to continuously change the contents on a web site?
What type of web technology provides news that can automatically download right to your desktop?
What type of web technology creates an online community where people can make statements and others can read and respond to those statements?
What type of technology allows you to verbally speak with someone over the Internet?
What kind of environment is Facebook or MySpace part of?
What term refers to living life through technology?
What 3-D environment allows you to speak to someone who is far away but, at the same time, see them as a holographic image?
What type of technology allows you to use your finger, eye, or voice print to secure your information resources?
In reference to your ethical structure, how much do you identify with the person or persons who will receive the benefit or suffer the harm is called which of the following?
Which tracking program records every keystroke you make on the computer?
What is a common medium used for thieves to steal others' identities?
What is it called when you are rerouted from your requested internet site to another, undesired site?
What is the term that refers to an ad hidden inside software that you downloaded from an internet site?
What type of monitoring file is commonly used on and accepted from Internet sites?

What type of software secretly collects information about you and your internet habits?

What type of information systems environment reuses self-contained blocks of code in its systems?
What term refers to the structure, and substructures, of an organization's information systems?
When two or more computers are able to share information, what is this called?
When there is little or no exchange of information within an organization's information systems, we say that the systems are _____.
When information and processing are spread throughout the organization via a network, we say the systems are _____.
When one computer provides services to another computer, the environment is a(n) _____ infrastructure.
What type of infrastructure are most enterprise applications employing?
When you continuously measure yourself against your peers, you are employing _____.

What type of infrastructure do companies employ to work with their customers?
